content.en: How do you spell the word "Taiwan"?
content.tw: 你知道「台灣」用英文要怎麼拼嗎？

content.en: One girl spelled Taiwan, and… she won a spelling bee! What's a spelling bee? It's a contest in American schools. Many students like it. Winners can go to state and national spelling bees.
content.tw: 拼字比賽在美國很受歡迎，學校比賽的冠軍可以參加全國拼字比賽。有一個女生因為拼出台灣，得到了冠軍！

content.en: In this contest, students try to spell words. They say the letters. But some English words are hard to spell.
content.tw: 參賽的學生需要說出單字的正確拼法，但有一些英語單字很難拼。

content.en: Kayla is an 8th grader. She is from Idaho. She went to a big spelling bee in Idaho. Kayla is a very good speller. But she didn't think she would win.
content.tw: 愛達荷州的國二學生 Kayla 參加了這項比賽，她覺得自己不會贏。

content.en: The words got harder and harder. One by one, students made spelling mistakes. Finally, there was only Kayla… and one more student. Kayla had one more word to spell. If she spelled it right, she would win.
content.tw: 但是單字越來越難，競爭對手一個一個被淘汰，剩下 Kayla 跟另外一個學生，Kayla 只要拼對最後一個字就會獲勝。

content.en: Kayla took a deep breath and said three letters: "T-A-I"... Then she said three more letters: "W-A-N". It was Taiwan! She was right! Kayla was the winner! She won $1000 dollars. And now she can go to the national spelling bee.
content.tw: 她答對了！Kayla 獲得冠軍，有一千美元獎金！現在她可以參加全國拼字大賽了。

content.en: Good luck at the national spelling bee, Kayla!
content.tw: 祝 Kayla 在全國拼字比賽中好運！

vocabulary.preface: 台灣這個字的英文其實很簡單，而Kayla拼對了。

content.text:
1. hard 困難的
I find these math problems really hard. 我發現這些數學題真的好難。
Don't look at me. I can't help you there. 別看我。我幫不上忙。
I didn't even ask. 我都還沒問呢。
I know. I'm just saying. 我知道，我只是說說。

2. harder 更困難
But it feels like it's getting harder and harder every day.
但是我覺得它一天比一天難。
That's because you're learning something new. 那是因為你在學新的東西。

3. mistake 錯誤
But I keep making mistakes. 但是我一直犯錯。
Of course. How else can you learn? 當然啦，要不然怎麼學？

4. contest 比賽
You sound like you've won math contests before. 你聽起來以前贏過數學比賽。
Not at all. 完全沒有。

vocabulary.postscript:
拼字比較難還是數學？
hard 困難的
harder 更困難
mistake 錯誤
contest 比賽

quiz.question: 1. Which U.S. state is Kayla from?
2. Where can Kayla go next?
options: a. The Iowa State Spelling Bee

quiz.question: 3. At spelling bees, how do students spell words?

title: Balloon Will Take People High Above Earth

content.en: Hey, students! Do you want to fly in a rocket? You can do that!
content.tw: 你們想要搭火箭嗎？

content.en: There is a new way to fly high. A Japanese company is making a balloon. The balloon can take people very high.
content.tw: 有一家日本公司製造了可以飛很高的氣球。

content.en: Some rockets go up to 400 kilometers. The balloon doesn't go up 400 kilometers. Space is 100 kilometers up, but the balloon doesn't go up 100 kilometers.
content.tw: 不過這顆氣球飛不到那麼高。

content.en: So… how high can the balloon fly? It can fly up to 22 kilometers. That's higher than jets fly. Twenty-two kilometers up… People can see the Earth!
content.tw: 它只能飛到 22 公里，但這樣已經比噴射機還要高，可以看到地球！

content.en: The balloon takes two hours to fly up 22 kilometers. It flies high for one hour. It takes one hour to come down.
content.tw: 這顆氣球上升到 22 公里的高度需要兩個小時。一小時之後，還要花一個鐘頭降落。

content.en: Two people can sit in the balloon. One person is the pilot. The other person is the passenger. The balloon ride is $175,000 US dollars, about 5 million NT dollars.
content.tw: 它可以搭載一位駕駛跟一位乘客，飛一趟大概要五百萬台幣。

content.en: The first trip is in October. That's very soon!
content.tw: 第一次旅程在十月。很快就到了！

vocabulary.preface: 這枚特殊的氣球，可以讓人滿足太空夢。

content.text:
1. high 高的
Have you ever flown in a hot air balloon? 你有坐過熱氣球嗎？
No. How high do they go up? 沒有。 它可以飛多高？

2. kilometer 公里
Some can go up to a few kilometers. 有的可以飛到好幾公里高。
Wow, that's pretty high! 哇，那很高呢！
How many kilometers can a rocket go up? 火箭可以飛幾公里高呢？
A rocket can fly much higher. 火箭就高得多了。

3. Earth 地球
Some rockets can go up to thousands of kilometers.
有的火箭可以飛到好幾千公里高。
That's crazy! 好狂喔！

4. trip 旅行
It would be amazing to see the Earth from there. 從那裏看地球會很棒！
Yeah, that'd be a real space trip. 對，那是真正的太空旅行。

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學到哪些單字？
high 高的
kilometer 公里
earth 地球
trip 旅行

quiz.question: 1. How high will the balloon fly?
2. How long will the balloon take to fly up?
3. Who can ride in the balloon?
options: A: One pilot and two passengers
C: One pilot and one passenger

content.en: We celebrate mothers on Mother's Day, and fathers on Father's Day. So, we celebrate brothers and sisters on Siblings Day. Siblings Day is on April 10th, which is today!
content.tw: 你有兄弟姊妹嗎？我們會慶祝父親節跟母親節，今天，我們要慶祝兄弟姐妹節。

content.en: Most people know their siblings. But some people don't!
content.tw: 我們都知道自己的兄弟姊妹是誰，但有人可能不知道喔。

content.en: Dacina and Traian are a sister and brother. They are from Romania. They did not have a mother or father. One family took Dacina. She was their new baby daughter. Another family took Traian. He was their new baby son. Dacina did not know Traian, and Traian did not know Dacina.
content.tw: Dacina 跟 Traian 是一對羅馬尼亞的姊弟，他們是孤兒，被不同的家庭領養，所以不認識彼此。

content.en: That was fifty years ago. This year, Dacina took a DNA test. Traian took a DNA test too. Their tests said "You have a sibling"!
content.tw: 50 多年後，他們兩個人剛好做了一次DNA測試，發現自己原來有兄弟姊妹。

content.en: Traian wrote Dacina a message. It said, "I think you're my sister!"
content.tw: Traian 傳訊息給 Dacina 說：「你好像是我姊姊！」

content.en: They are excited. Some things are the same! Dacina lives in Canada. Traian lives in Canada too! Dacina has a son. Traian has a son too! Dacina's son's name is Victor. And… Traian's son's name is Victor too!
content.tw: 他們之間有好多巧合，兩個人都在加拿大，兩個人也各有一個兒子，而且兩個兒子都叫做 Victor！

content.en: They are happy. Dacina has a new brother. Traian has a new sister. They are siblings! Happy Siblings Day!
content.tw: 他們很開心。Dacina 有了新弟弟，Traian 有了新妹妹。他們是兄弟姊妹！兄弟姊妹節快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 有的人因為從小就分開，並不認識自己的兄弟姊妹。

content.text: 1. family 家庭\nDo you come from a big family, Jane? 你來自大家庭嗎？\nYes, I think so. My mom had four children. 我想是，我媽媽有四個孩子。

2. sister 姊妹
My older sister and brother went to the U.S. years ago.
我姊姊和哥哥很多年前就去了美國。
So you don't know them well. 所以你跟他們不太熟。
Indeed I don't. 確實不熟。

3. father 父親
Come to think of it, I didn't know my father well either.
仔細想來，我跟我爸爸也不熟。
Even though you lived together? 即使你們住在一起？
Even though I had lived with him for 25 years. 即使我跟他住了25年。

4. say 說
I have to say some fathers are hard to get close to.
我必須說有的爸爸很難親近。
Mine was like that. 我爸就是那樣。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字很常用。
family 家庭
sister 姊妹
father 父親
say 說

quiz.question: 1. What are siblings?
2. Where do Dacina and Traian live now?
3. How do Dacina and Traian know they are siblings?
options: A: They took a DNA test

title: The Pet Crocodile That Loves a Cuddle

content.en: Hey there! Today is International Pet Day. I'm at my local pet store. I want a new pet! Let's see… They have dogs… cats… and birds… Hi! Oh, and they have… crocodiles?
content.tw: 今天是國際寵物日，我在寵物店裡面，這裡有狗狗、貓咪、小鳥，還有... 鱷魚？

content.en: A man named Jonathan has a pet crocodile! Jonathan lives in Mexico. He went to a pet store there. He bought a small, green, and angry crocodile! Jonathan named her Gamora. Gamora is the angry alien in the Guardians of the Galaxy movies!
content.tw: Jonathan 住在墨西哥，他去寵物店買了一隻小小、綠綠，還很兇的鱷魚！Jonathan 叫牠 Gamora，Gamora 就是星際異攻隊裡面那個生氣的外星人。

content.en: Crocodiles can be very scary! They have the strongest bite in the world. A crocodile bite might be stronger than a T. rex bite!
content.tw: 鱷魚的咬合力是世界上最強的，有可能比暴龍還強，很恐怖！

content.en: Jonathan is lucky. Gamora isn't scary. She loves cuddles. Gamora acts like a dog! She sleeps in Jonathan's bed. She poses for photos too!
content.tw: 不過 Jonathan 很幸運，因為 Gamora 不恐怖，牠喜歡抱抱，就像狗狗一樣！牠還睡在 Jonathan 的床上，還會擺姿勢拍照！

content.en: Gamora swims in a pool. She has a nice, dry place too. She sunbathes there.
content.tw: Gamora 可以在池子裡游泳，也可以在外面做日光浴。

content.en: Gamora eats lots of meat. Jonathan has two pet Chihuahuas too. They are lucky. Gamora hasn't eaten them! Yet…
content.tw: Gamora 吃很多肉， Jonathan 還有兩隻吉娃娃，幸好 Gamora 還沒有把他們吃掉...

content.en: Hmm… Maybe I'll get a goldfish instead!
content.tw: 嗯... 也許我還是養隻金魚吧！

vocabulary.preface: 鱷魚真的能當寵物嗎? 墨西哥這隻小鱷魚好像可以。

content.text:
1. swim 游泳
I often feel lonely. 我常常覺得寂寞。
I think you need a pet. 我覺得你需要養寵物。
What can it do? 寵物能做什麼？
It'll love you and swim with you. 牠會愛你，跟你一起游泳。
You mean a dolphin? 你是說海豚嗎？

2. bite 咬
Don't be silly; you can't buy a dolphin. 別傻了，你買不到海豚。
Most dogs can swim. 大部分狗狗都會游泳。
But I don't want a pet that bites. 但是我不要會咬人的寵物。

3. scary 讓人害怕
Then maybe you'd like rabbits. 那你也許會喜歡兔子。
Rabbits are not scary. 兔子不會讓人害怕。

4. pet store 寵物店
No, no rabbits. 不要兔子。
How about goldfish? 金魚怎麼樣？
Let's go to a pet store first. 我們先去寵物店吧。

vocabulary.postscript:
你有沒有寵物呢？
swim 游泳
bite 咬
scary 讓人害怕
pet store 寵物店

quiz.question: 1. What is Jonathan's pet crocodile's name?
2. Where does Jonathan live?
3. What other pets does Jonathan have?

content.en: A marathon is a long running race. It is 42 kilometers long!
content.tw: 一場馬拉松要跑42 公里。

content.en: What about an ultramarathon? An ultramarathon is hundreds of kilometers long.
content.tw: 超級馬拉松怎麼樣呢？ 要跑好幾百公里！

content.en: What about an ultramarathon in the cold, icy Arctic?
content.tw: 如果是辦在冰天雪地的北極超級馬拉松呢？

content.en: The Yukon Arctic Ultra is in the cold, icy Arctic. It's an ultramarathon in Canada. It's 700 kilometers long. Tommy Chen ran this ultramarathon. Tommy is from Taiwan!
content.tw: 加拿大的育空極地超馬賽有 700 公里，來自台灣的陳彥博是參賽選手之一！

content.en: At the start of the race, Tommy had lots of energy. He was confident. This was his second Yukon Arctic Ultra. He knew the way.
content.tw: 比賽一開始，陳彥博精力充沛。這是他第二次參加這場比賽，對路很熟，他很有信心。

content.en: Tommy wore a heavy jacket and warm pants. He did not feel very cold. At night, he slept in a tent.
content.tw: 他穿著厚重衣褲保暖，晚上就睡在帳篷裡。

content.en: For ten days, Tommy ran... and ran... and ran some more... He got tired. The winter sky was dark. He was lonely. Near the end of the race, he almost got lost.
content.tw: 他一跑就是十天，跑得好累。冬天黑暗的天空也讓他覺得寂寞。快結束的時候，還差一點迷路。

content.en: Then Tommy was on the trail again. And…he finished the race! He was in fourth place! He did a celebration dance! Nothing can stop him! Good job, Tommy Chen.
content.tw: 然後，陳彥博再次回到賽道上。他完成了比賽！他獲得了第四名！他還跳了慶祝舞！沒有什麼能阻止他！做得好，陳彥博。

vocabulary.preface: 台灣選手參加北極超級馬拉松比賽，挑戰自己的極限。

content.text: 1. run 跑步. Do you run, Nancy? 你跑步嗎? Not every day. 不是每天跑. I run three or four times a week. 我一個星期跑三四次. Do you? 你呢? No, not really. 我不大跑.
2. cold 冷的. Running is not fun, and it's often too cold outside. You'll get warm when you run. 你跑就會覺得暖和. I'll get tired too.我會累.
3. lost 迷路. And I may get lost. 而且還可能迷路. How can you get lost? 你怎麼會迷路? You're just running near your house! 你只是在家附近跑.
4. night 夜晚. I can only run at night. 我只能晚上跑. That's why. 這是理由. I'll join you next time.下次我跟你一起跑.

vocabulary.postscript: 慢跑是非常好的運動. run跑步 cold冷的 lost迷路 night夜晚

quiz.question: 1. At the start of the race, how did Tommy feel?
2. How far did Tommy run?
3. At the end of the race, what did Tommy do?

content.en: Today is the start of the traditional New Year in Thailand! The Thai New Year is called Songkran. It is in April every year. It's Thailand's most famous festival. There's a lot of music and dancing!
content.tw: 今天是泰國傳統新年--潑水節！潑水節在每一年四月，是泰國最有名的慶典，大家會在這一天唱唱跳跳。

content.en: There's a lot of water too. Water is very important for Songkran. There are lots of big water fights! People throw water at each other. They shoot water guns! Everyone has fun. And everyone gets very, very wet!
content.tw: 潑水節大家還會打水仗！他們會互相潑水、射水槍，全身都會溼答答。

content.en: There are lots of competitions at Songkran. There are cool drum competitions. The drums are very big! The drummers can use any part of their body. They use their hands, their feet, their elbows… or their heads!
content.tw: 潑水節還有很多不同的比賽。有個很酷的打鼓比賽，參賽者可以用身體的任何部位去打一面大鼓！

content.en: In Thailand, Songkran is very important for Buddhists. They go to a temple. They pour water on images of the Buddha. They also pour water on the hands of Buddhist monks. This is a sign of respect.
content.tw: 潑水節對泰國的佛教徒來說也很重要。他們會去寺廟，澆水在釋迦摩尼佛的神像上，也會澆水在和尚的手上。這是他們表達尊重的方式。

content.en: Thailand wants Songkran to be more famous. They want everyone to know about Songkran. They want more people to visit Thailand.
content.tw: 泰國希望大家認識他們的潑水節，也希望更多人來泰國玩。

content.en: Today is an exciting day in Thailand. There is music, dancing, competitions, and lots and lots of water! Songkran ends on Saturday. Happy Songkran, everyone!
content.tw: 今天是泰國令人興奮的一天。有音樂、舞蹈、比賽，還有很多很多水！潑水節在週六結束。大家潑水節快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 名聞遐邇的泰國潑水節，充滿熱帶國家風情。

content.text:
1. wet 潮濕的
Songkran in Thailand sounds so much fun! 泰國潑水節聽起來真有趣！
Yeah, I'd sure like to go. 對啊，我好想去。
I've heard that you get wet from head to toe. 我聽說你會從頭到腳濕透透。

2. everyone 每個人
And people carry big water guns for a nice water fight. 大家會拿著水槍打水仗。
With strangers on the street? 跟路上的陌生人打？
With everyone on the street! 跟路上每個人打！

3. fight 搏鬥
That's so cool! 太酷了！
I would pick children to fight with. 我會找小孩子來打水仗。
They may be much better than you. 他們可能比你強得多呢。

4. April 四月
So we're going next April? 所以我們明年四月去？
Absolutely! 一定要的。

vocabulary.postscript:
我們來讀今天的單字。
wet 潮濕的
everyone 每個人
fight 搏鬥
April 四月

quiz.question: 1. What is Songkran?
2. What do people throw at Songkran?
3. Where do Buddhists go for Songkran?

content.en: Ahh! That's better… now I need to wash my hands!
Toilets are great! They take our germs away. That helps us to be healthy.
Without toilets, people can get very sick. But toilets cost money. Some people don't have money for a toilet.
content.tw: 抽水馬桶可以帶走細菌，讓我們保持健康。但有一些人買不起抽水馬桶。

content.en: In Cambodia, there's a big lake. It's called the Tonle Sap. It's the biggest fishing lake in the world!
content.tw: 柬埔寨的洞里薩湖，是全世界最大的漁業湖泊。

content.en: About 100,000 people live on the Tonle Sap. They live in floating villages. They have houses and schools. But they do not have toilets. The lake water is very dirty.
content.tw: 洞里薩湖上住了大約十萬人，他們住在漂浮村落，村子裡有房屋跟學校，但是沒有抽水馬桶，所以湖水很髒。

content.en: The people there are very poor. They use the lake water for everything. They use it for cleaning.They use it for cooking.Some use it for drinking. That can make them very sick.
content.tw: 當地居民十分貧困，他們用湖水洗衣服、煮飯，有一些人還會喝，這讓他們很容易生病。

content.en: A company wants to help these people. It wants them to use floating toilets!
These floating toilets are called "HandyPods". HandyPods clean the dirty toilet water. They help make the lake water safe.
content.tw: 有一家公司想要幫助這些人，製造出「方便飄浮馬桶」。這種馬桶可以處理排泄物，讓湖水比較安全。

content.en: Now there are 100 HandyPods on the Tonle Sap. The company wants 200 more HandyPods there by 2025. That's 300 HandyPods!
content.tw: 現在洞里薩湖上面有100個方便漂浮馬桶，公司希望2025年以前再多設置200個。

content.en: Floating toilets for floating villages, to help people stay healthy! What a great idea!
content.tw: 漂浮村莊的漂浮廁所，幫助人們保持健康！真是個好主意！

vocabulary.preface: 柬埔寨的水上房屋現在有了更好的廁所。

content.text: 1. floating 漂浮的 Have you heard of a floating house? 你有聽過漂浮房屋嗎？ Yes, I have. They are homes that float on the water. 有啊，就是浮在水面上的家。
2. in the world 世界上 That's right. 沒錯。 There are many floating houses in the world. 世界上有很多漂浮房屋。 Like in the Netherlands. 就像荷蘭。 Exactly. 正是。
3. people 人們 I can imagine why the Dutch people like them. 我可以想像為什麼荷蘭人喜歡它。 Oh, why? 為什麼呢？ They can just float away if they don't like their neighbors. 要是他們不喜歡鄰居，就可以漂走。
4. fish 釣魚 Or it's because they can go fishing anytime they want. That too. 也是。

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字很有趣。 floating 漂浮的 in the world 世界上 people 人們 fish 釣魚

quiz.question: 1. What is the world's biggest fishing lake?
2. Where are these floating villages?
3. How many HandyPods are on the lake now?

title: Taiwan Ranked Happiest Country in East Asia

content.tw: 你好！

content.en: Good morning! That woman is so happy! Hmmm... How happy is everyone in Taiwan?
There is a big group of countries. It is called the United Nations. Some people call the United Nations "the UN".
content.tw: United Nations 聯合國，它是一個由很多國家組成的組織，英文縮寫是 "UN"。

content.en: The UN makes a list. It shows how happy countries are. This list is the "World Happiness Report".
The UN makes the list every year. It takes a long time. The list is not easy to make. The UN has to be fair.
content.tw: 聯合國每一年都會製作一份「世界幸福報告」，看看每個國家的人有多幸福。

content.en: The UN looks at many things. Do people feel good? Do they have a family? Do they have friends? Do people have jobs? Do they have money? Do they feel free? Can people get help? Do they think their country is good?
content.tw: 這份報告是看人們開不開心、有沒有家庭或是朋友、有沒有工作和金錢、是否覺得很自由、能夠獲得協助，還有是否認為自己的國家很棒。

content.en: This year's World Happiness Report lists 137 countries.
The report says Taiwan is the happiest country in East Asia! The three happiest countries in East Asia are Taiwan, Japan, and South Korea.
content.tw: 137個國家排名下來，東亞第一名是台灣！前三名是台灣、日本，還有南韓。

content.en: Finland is the happiest country in the world. Finland has been the happiest country for six years!
content.tw: 芬蘭已經連續六年蟬聯全世界最幸福的國家！

content.en: The three happiest countries in the world are Finland, Denmark, and Iceland. They are in Europe.
content.tw: 世界前三名就是芬蘭、丹麥，還有冰島，這三個國家都在北歐。

content.en: Which country will be the happiest next year? Good luck, Taiwan! We can do it!
content.tw: 哪個國家明年會是最幸福的呢？台灣，祝你好運！我們做得到！

vocabulary.preface: 聯合國的報告說，台灣是個幸福國家。

content.text:
1. feel 感覺
This is something I really don't understand. 這我就真的不懂了。

2. country 國家
It's a northern country. 它是個北方國家。
It's so cold and dark there! 那兒又冷又陰暗！
Winter lasts five months in Finland. 芬蘭的冬季有五個月。

3. family 家人
Maybe it's because they have a loving family and many friends.
也許是因為他們有親愛的家人和很多朋友。
Family and friends are important, I know. 我知道家人朋友很重要。

4. look at 看著
But so is sunshine. 但是陽光也很重要。
I guess people can look at the sun online. 我想大家可以上網看太陽。

vocabulary.postscript:
你的日子過得好不好呢？來讀單字。
feel 感覺
country 國家
family 家人
look at 看著

quiz.question: 1. What is another name for "the UN"?
2. How many countries are in this year's report?
3. What is the happiest country in the world?

title: Italy Wants to Keep its Food Safe

content.en: Ah! Italy…
content.tw: 啊！義大利…

content.en: Italy is a country. It's in Europe. It has a long history. It has a great culture.
content.tw: 義大利是一個國家。它位於歐洲，擁有悠久的歷史和偉大的文化。

content.en: The Romans lived there two thousand years ago. They made beautiful statues, temples, and other things.
content.tw: 義大利是歐洲一個歷史悠久的國家。羅馬人兩千年前在義大利創造了美麗的雕像還有聖殿。

content.en: We can see many of these things in Italy today. They are very, very old! But Italy keeps them safe. They are important to Italian people. These things are part of their heritage.
content.tw: 現在到義大利還能看到這些東西，它們歷史悠久，對義大利人來說意義重大，所以要好好保存。這是他們的文化遺產。

content.en: We all have a heritage. It is important. Heritage comes from our family. It comes from the history and culture of our family's country.
content.tw: 我們都有遺產，有時候是家庭遺產，有時候是國家的歷史跟文化。

content.en: Where is your family from? Taiwan? Then you have Taiwanese heritage.
content.tw: 你的家人來自哪裡？台灣嗎？那麼你就有台灣的文化遺產。

content.en: Italians love their heritage. They share Italy's history and culture.
content.tw: 義大利人熱愛他們的文化遺產。他們分享著義大利的歷史和文化。

content.en: It's important for countries to keep their heritage safe. So there is a list.
content.tw: 保存國家的文化遺產很重要，所以有人列了一張名單。

content.en: Some very famous things are on this list. The Taj Mahal in India and the Great Wall of China are on the list.
content.tw: 上面有印度的泰姬瑪哈陵，還有中國的萬里長城。

content.en: Now Italy wants to put something new on this list. It's not a statue or a temple… It's their food!
content.tw: 現在義大利想要在這個名單加上新的東西，不是雕像也不是聖殿，而是他們的食物。

content.en: Everyone loves Italian food! Pizza, pasta, ice cream… YUM! Italians want to keep their food safe. Then everyone can enjoy their heritage for many, many years! Today is World Heritage Day. What is your heritage?
content.tw: 大家都愛義大利食物！披薩、義大利麵、冰淇淋…真好吃！義大利人想要保護他們的食物，這樣大家就能長久地享受他們的文化遺產！今天是世界遺產日。你的文化遺產是什麼？

vocabulary.preface: 義大利有豐富的文化遺產，還有美味的義大利菜。

content.text:
1. culture 文化
I love Italian food! 我愛義大利菜！
Me too. 我也是。
Italian people must have a happy culture. 義大利人一定有快樂的文化。
Even their food is good for celebrations. 連他們的食物也很適合慶祝。

2. history 歷史
Like pizza? 比如說披薩嗎？
Like pizza. 比如說披薩。
You just have to share when eating it. 吃披薩一定要大家分享。
I agree. 我同意。
I also like reading about the history of the Romans. 我也喜歡讀羅馬人的歷史。

3. thousand 千
Two thousand years of history. 兩千年的歷史。
Right, isn't that amazing? 對，很驚人吧？
It's almost as long as Chinese history. 幾乎跟中國歷史一樣長。

4. old 老的
Both countries are old. 兩個國家都很老。
Very old. 非常老。

vocabulary.postscript:
Please read the words with me.
culture 文化
history 歷史
thousand 千
old 老的

quiz.question: 1. Where does our heritage come from?
2. Where did the ancient Romans live?
3. What does Italy want to put on the list?

content.en: I'm at an ice cream shop. I want one small scoop of ice cream. There are many flavors! There's chocolate… strawberry… vanilla… WAIT! What is that?! Crickets?! In ice cream?!
content.tw: 我在冰淇淋店裡面，有好多種口味可以選，有巧克力、草莓，還有... 蟋蟀？

content.en: That's right! That's a strange flavor. Thomas is a cook. He makes strange ice cream flavors. He made liver sausage and cheese ice cream! One time, Thomas put gold on ice cream! It was 130 NT dollars for one scoop!
content.tw: Thomas 是個廚師。他做過很多奇怪口味的冰淇淋，像是豬肝香腸口味跟起司口味。還有一次 Thomas 把黃金放在冰淇淋上，一球要 130 元台幣！

content.en: Now he makes cricket ice cream! How does Thomas make this strange ice cream? He uses cream, vanilla, honey, and flour. Flour is in cookies and noodles too. But this flour is cricket flour. You can't see these crickets.
content.tw: 這款冰淇淋是用奶油、香草、蜂蜜，跟麵粉做的。做餅乾跟麵條也會用到麵粉。但是這款冰淇淋用的麵粉是蟋蟀麵粉，你看不到裡面的蟋蟀。

content.en: Thomas also puts dried crickets on each scoop. You can see these crickets. Yummy…
content.tw: 但Thomas也會在每一球冰淇淋上放一隻蟋蟀乾，你可以吃掉牠！

content.en: Some people don't like his cricket ice cream. They think it looks nasty! But Thomas says most people love it!
content.tw: 有一些人不喜歡，不想吃蟋蟀冰淇淋，但 Thomas 說很多人都很愛。

content.en: What do you think? Would you eat cri… Ah! It's in my hair! Get it off me!
content.tw: 你覺得呢？你會吃蟋蟀…啊！牠在我頭髮上！把它弄掉！

vocabulary.preface: 冰淇淋口味千變萬化，連蟋蟀都可以包括進去。

content.text:
1. chocolate 巧克力
Have you tried the new ice cream place over there? 你去過那裡的冰淇淋店嗎？
No, is it good? 沒有，好吃嗎？
Yeah, their chocolate ice cream is unbelievable!

2. flavor 味道
But my favorite flavor is vanilla. 但是我最喜歡的味道是香草。
They have that, too. 他們也有。
Vanilla with honey. 香草加蜂蜜.

3. strange 奇怪的
That sounds a little strange. 聽起來有一點兒奇怪。
Maybe, but I heard it's very good. 也許吧，不過我聽說很好吃.

4. noodle 麵條
I'm in the mood for some noodles, though. 不過我現在想吃麵。
Great idea! Who wants ice cream on a rainy day? 好主意! 誰要下雨天吃冰淇淋？

vocabulary.postscript:
你愛吃冰淇淋嗎？
chocolate 巧克力
flavor 味道
strange 奇怪的
noodle 麵條

quiz.question: 1. Which strange ice cream was 130 NT dollars for a scoop?
2. What does Thomas use for his new ice cream?
3. Why don't some people want to try Thomas' new ice cream?

content.en: Oh, excuse me. I'm brushing my teeth. There! I'm finished. Sorry about that.
It's important to take care of your teeth. It's easy. You need a toothbrush, toothpaste, floss, and… your teeth!
content.tw: 照顧牙齒很重要，也很簡單，你只需要一支牙刷、一條牙膏、一捲牙線，還有你的牙齒！

content.en: How many times do you brush your teeth every day? Do you brush them two times? Three times? But toothbrushes can't brush between your teeth. Floss can. Do you floss your teeth?
content.tw: 你每天刷幾次牙？牙刷刷不進的牙縫，可以用牙線，你會用牙線嗎？

content.en: It's important to take care of your gums too. Do you know what gums are? Open your mouth. Look! Your gums hold your teeth. Brushing and flossing make gums healthy too.
content.tw: 照顧牙齦也很重要，牙齦就是固定你的牙齒的部分。

content.en: Some people get gum disease. Their gums hurt. Ouch! What? No, chewing gum does not cause gum disease. Go ahead and chew gum. Not brushing or flossing causes gum disease.
content.tw: 有一些人會有牙周病，牙齦會很痛！不過嚼口香糖不會造成牙周病，不刷牙跟不用牙線才會。

content.en: Gum disease can make chewing hurt. It can make teeth fall out! Now scientists think gum disease can make other parts of the body hurt too.
content.tw: 牙周病讓牙齒咀嚼的時候很痛，還有可能會掉牙。科學家認為，牙周病也有可能會傷害身體的其他的部位。

content.en: Hmm... let's see. I brush and floss my teeth every day. And later, I won't get gum disease. Chewing won't hurt. My teeth won't fall out. Other parts of my body, like my hands and knees, won't hurt. Great!
I take good care of my teeth. I hope you do, too!
content.tw: 我好好照顧我的牙齒。我希望你也一樣！

vocabulary.preface: 健康的牙齒，對身體有極大的幫助。

content.text: 1. toothbrush 牙刷 For our trip this weekend… 我們這周的旅行... Yeah? 怎麼樣？ 我想只帶一隻牙刷。
2. time 次數 Bad idea. 這主意不好。 我們會住五星級飯店。 他們什麼都有。 你住過這種飯店幾次？ 一次也沒有。
3. need 需要 你還是需要換洗衣服。 好吧，那很容易。
4. chew 咀嚼 What else? 還有什麼？ 身體乳液，口香糖... 你怎麼知道我需要口香糖？ 你不是正在吃？

vocabulary.postscript: 請注意，讀單字時間。 toothbrush 牙刷 time 次數 need 需要 chew 咀嚼

quiz.question: 1. What do you need to brush your teeth?
2. What causes gum disease?
3. What do scientists think gum disease can do?
options: A: Make other parts of the body hurt

title: Kids to Record Roads for Earth Day

content.en: Tomorrow is Earth Day! I'm at the National Museum of Natural Science in Taichung. The museum has lots of stones, plants, animals, and insects.
content.tw: 明天就是世界地球日！我現在人在台中科博館，裡面有很多岩石、植物、動物，跟昆蟲。

content.en: There are bees, butterflies, crickets and many more insects…
content.tw: 這裡有蜜蜂、蝴蝶、蟋蟀等等。

content.en: Insects help make the earth healthy. We need them! But many insects are dying all over the earth.
content.tw: 昆蟲讓我們的地球更健康，但是世界上很多昆蟲正在慢慢地滅亡。

content.en: There's a natural science museum in the UK too. It's called the Natural History Museum. It has a big science project for Earth Day. Kids in the UK can help!
content.tw: 英國也有科博館，叫做自然史博物館。這間博物館有一個世界地球日的計畫，讓英國的小孩可以幫忙！

content.en: The project is about insects and noise. Are loud noises bad for insects? Scientists don't know.
content.tw: 科學家想知道噪音是不是對昆蟲不好。

content.en: The project is very easy… First, kids pick a road. Some roads are quiet. There's not much noise. Some roads are noisy.
content.tw: 要怎麼做呢？很簡單，小孩子可以先挑選一條路，有一些路很安靜，有一些很吵。

content.en: Kids record the noise on their road for five minutes. Next, kids look at 10 meters of their road. They record all the insects they see. Then they send everything to the museum. Scientists will study this information.
content.tw: 孩子們要先在路邊錄音五分鐘，然後在路旁十公尺紀錄所有他們看到的昆蟲，再把所有資料送到博物館裡面，然後科學家會負責研究。

content.en: What are you doing for Earth Day?
content.tw: 你為地球日做了什麼？

vocabulary.preface: 英國的小學生，幫忙科學家研究昆蟲。

content.text: 1. butterfly 蝴蝶。We're going on a field trip tomorrow. 我們明天要校外教學。To see butterflies. 去看蝴蝶。Are you going to the Taipei Zoo? 你們要去台北動物園嗎？
2. insect 昆蟲。They have a good Insect Hall... 他們有很好的昆蟲館...With butterflies and other bugs. 有蝴蝶和其他昆蟲。
3. natural 自然的。No, we want a more natural environment. 不是，我們要更自然的環境。We'll be going to Yangmingshan. 我們要上陽明山。
4. quiet 安靜的。That's a nice and quiet place. 那是很安靜的好地方。No, it's never quiet on holidays. 不，陽明山假日的時候並不安靜。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡看蝴蝶嗎? 我們一起來讀今天的單字。
butterfly 蝴蝶
insect 昆蟲
natural 自然的
quiet 安靜的

quiz.question: 1. Where is the National Museum of Natural Science?
2. What are some insects?
3. What do kids record for the project?
options: a. Noise and insects on a road
c. Earth Day in the UK

title: What Time Is It on the Moon?

content.en: What time is it in New York? I know that's a hard question.
content.tw: 你知道現在紐約幾點嗎？

content.en: New York is 12 hours behind Taiwan. When it's noon here, it's midnight in New York. You're eating lunch. But kids in New York are sleeping.
content.tw: 紐約比台灣慢 12 個小時，現在這裡是中午，所以紐約那裡是半夜。你吃午餐的時候，紐約的小孩在睡覺。

content.en: Japan is one hour ahead of Taiwan. It's noon here. But it's 1 PM there. Kids in Japan are finished with lunch.
content.tw: 日本比台灣早一個小時，那裡現在是下午一點，日本的小孩已經吃完午餐了。

content.en: New York, Japan, and Taiwan are in different time zones. The world has 24 time zones. Here's a very hard question. What time is it on the moon?
content.tw: 紐約、日本跟台灣都在不同的時區，全球有24個時區。但你知道月球上現在幾點嗎？

content.en: Well, no one knows. Different countries say different times! Astronauts from different countries want to work together. But they need to use the same time.
content.tw: 不同國家的太空人要一起工作，但是他們需要一致的時間。

content.en: There is a problem. The moon's gravity and the earth's gravity are different. Clocks are faster there.
content.tw: 這是個大問題，因為月球上的重力跟地球不一樣，時鐘在月球上跑得比較快。

content.en: Scientists want to make a moon time zone. Then everyone will know what time it is on the moon.
content.tw: 科學家想要創造一個月球時區，這樣大家就知道月球上現在幾點了。

content.en: A moon time zone is a great idea!
content.tw: 月球時區是個很棒的主意！

vocabulary.preface: 月球時間要怎麼計算? 科學家正在研究。

content.text:
1. midnight 半夜
You should go to bed. 你應該上床了。
It's already midnight. 已經半夜三更了。
Midnight is still early, you know. 半夜其實很早，你知道。

2. finish 結束
Yeah, for people across the Pacific. 是啊，對太平洋那一頭的人來說。
I mean it. 真的啊。
Some people are just starting their day, but I have finished my work.
有的人才剛開始一天，我卻已經結束工作了。

3. work 工作
I want more time to sleep and less time at work.
我要的是多一點時間睡覺，少一點工作。
Same here. 我也一樣。

4. hard 困難的
But what about more money for more work? 但是多工作就多賺錢如何？
That's a hard one. 這個問題有點難。

vocabulary.postscript:
來讀讀單字。
midnight 半夜
finish 結束
work 工作
hard 困難的

quiz.question: 1. It is 1:30 p.m. in Taiwan. What time is it in New York?
2. What is the problem with time on the moon?
3. What do scientists want to make?

content.en: Ouch! A cut! It's so small… It's tiny! But this tiny wound hurts so much! I need a bandage.
content.tw: 我割傷了！傷口好小，可是好痛！我需要一條 OK 繃。

content.en: Do you know about the new "smart bandages"? The smart bandages are stretchy. These stretchy bandages are easy to use. You can put one on any wound.
content.tw: 你有聽過「智慧繃帶」嗎？這種繃帶可以拉很長，包覆在各種傷口上。

content.en: These smart bandages have tiny computers. These tiny computers look for heat and germs. They look for changes too. Good changes mean the wound is healing. Bad changes mean it needs more help. The tiny computers send this information to a big computer.
content.tw: 這種繃帶具備細小的電腦，偵測傷口是否發熱、有細菌或是有變化。好的變化代表傷口正在癒合，如果變壞，代表需要更多治療。小電腦會把資料傳送到大電腦上。

content.en: Tiny bits of electricity help wounds heal faster. The tiny computers can give wounds tiny bits of electricity! Medicine is also in these smart bandages. Does a wound need more help? A smart bandage can put medicine on it!
content.tw: 小電腦還會釋放微量電流，讓傷口更快癒合，甚至可以幫傷口上藥！

content.en: My tiny wound doesn't need a smart bandage. It can heal quickly with no help. These smart bandages are for big wounds. Some people get big wounds from fires. These bandages can help big wounds a lot.
content.tw: 我的傷口很小，不用智慧繃帶，這種智慧繃帶是給燒傷的那種大傷口用的。

content.en: Scientists are testing these smart bandages now. The bandages are not ready yet. Many people have big wounds. These are the people who need smart bandages. The smart bandages are pretty cool. But I don't want to need one!
content.tw: 科學家正在測試這些智慧繃帶。這些繃帶還沒有準備好。許多人都有大傷口。這些人需要智慧繃帶。智慧繃帶很酷。但我不想用到！

vocabulary.preface: 科技進步，簡單的繃帶現在能做許多事。

content.text: 1. hurt 痛 Hey, what happened to you? 發生了什麼事？ It must hurt a lot! 一定很痛吧！ You're telling me. 還用你說。
2. look for 尋找 How did you get hurt? 你是怎麼受傷的？ I fell down the stairs looking for my glasses. 我找眼鏡時摔下樓梯。 You really need your glasses to see the stairs. 你真的需要眼鏡來看樓梯。 I know that! 我也知道！
3. wound 傷口 Okay, okay, but you should cover the wound. 好啦，不過你應該把傷口蓋起來。 No, I'm fine. 不用，我很好。 Here, let me put this bandage on it. 來吧，我把這個OK繃貼上去。
4. heal 癒合 Will it help me heal? 它會讓我癒合嗎？ That's what the ad said. 廣告是這麼說的。

vocabulary.postscript: 你今天學到哪些單字？ hurt 痛 look for 尋找 wound 傷口 heal 癒合

quiz.question: 1. Which do the smart bandage's tiny computers look for?
2. What can the smart bandage give a wound?
3. What kind of wounds are the smart bandages for?

title: Couple Weds at Taylor Swift Concert

content.en: Narrator: Hi! I'm at a wedding! The bride! She's so beautiful! Voice: You may now kiss the bride… Narrator: What a beautiful wedding!
content.tw: 旁白：嗨！我在一場婚禮上！新娘！她真美！聲音：你現在可以親吻新娘了… 旁白：多麼美麗的婚禮啊！

content.en: Every couple wants something different for their wedding. Some couples want a small wedding. Some couples want a big wedding. And some couples want a very, very different wedding!
content.tw: 每一對新人都想要不一樣的婚禮，有人喜歡小型婚禮，有人期待盛大的結婚儀式，也有人希望有很特別的婚禮！

content.en: Rene and Max are a couple. First they wanted a small wedding. But then Rene had a crazy idea… Rene is a "Swiftie". A Swiftie is a Taylor Swift superfan! Is Taylor Swift your favorite singer? Do you love her more than all other singers? Yeah? Then you're a Swiftie too!
content.tw: Rene 跟 Max 原本只想舉辦小型婚禮，但 Rene 是一個 "Swiftie"，也就是泰勒絲的粉絲。

content.en: Rene and Max went to a Taylor Swift concert. Max was wearing a nice black suit. Rene was wearing a beautiful white dress. They waited and waited… Then Taylor Swift began to sing Rene's favorite song. Rene walked slowly to Max. They were in front of the stage.
content.tw: 新郎穿著西裝，新娘穿著婚紗參加泰勒絲的演唱會，當泰勒絲唱到 Rene 最愛的歌曲時，Rene 在舞台前面緩緩地走向 Max。

content.en: Rene and Max were having their wedding at a Taylor Swift concert! They kissed. Thousands of Swifties cheered! There's a video for their wedding. It's on the Internet. People have watched it over 6 million times!
content.tw: 兩個人在泰勒絲的演唱會完婚，在好幾千位 Swiftie 歡呼聲中接吻。這部影片在網路上點閱超過六百萬次！

vocabulary.preface: 這對新人選擇在演唱會中結婚，是不是很浪漫？

content.text:
1. crazy 瘋狂的
Have you ever thought about your wedding? 你有想過你的婚禮嗎？
I have. 想過。
Will you do something crazy? 會不會做一些瘋狂的事？
Probably not. 大概不會。

2. favorite 最喜歡的
But I do want to get married outdoors. 不過我是想在戶外結婚。
Like in the mountains? 比如說在山上？
Yeah, one of my favorite places is Sun Moon Lake.
對，我最喜歡的地方之一是日月潭。

3. first 首先
First I'll invite all my friends there. 首先我會邀請所有的朋友去。
And then I'll have someone sing for us. 然後請人為我們唱歌。

4. wear 穿著
And wear a beautiful white dress. 然後穿上美麗的白色洋裝。
Sure, white is pretty. 當然，白色很好看。

vocabulary.postscript:
你今天學到哪些單字？
crazy 瘋狂的
favorite 最喜歡的
first 首先
wear 穿著

quiz.question: 1. Where did Rene and Max have their wedding?
2. How many times have people watched their wedding video?
3. What is a "Swiftie"?

title: Man Gets Degree 52 Years After Beginning

content.en: Yay! I'm finished studying! I went to college. I studied for two years. I got a degree in cooking! My degree shows I can cook well.
content.tw: 唸了兩年，我終於從廚藝學校畢業了！

content.en: Some people go to college or university. They want a degree. A degree shows they studied something. Some degrees take two years. Some take four or five years. But guess what? One man's degree took fifty-two years! That's a very long time!
content.tw: 有一些人去讀大學，想要拿學位。學位是他們學習的證明，有一些學位需要兩年時間，有些要四到五年。但有一個人花了五十二年！

content.en: Nick wanted a Ph.D. A Ph.D is one of the highest degrees. Ph.D. students think of new ideas. They study their new ideas. Nick studied his math idea. It was 1970. He was 23 years old.
content.tw: Nick 想要讀博士，是最高的學位。博士生需要構思新點子，並且做研究。Nick 在1970 年，也就是他 23 歲的時候，開始攻讀數學博士學位。

content.en: He studied for five years. But… he did not finish his degree! Nick did not study for a long time. His idea was big. He wanted to think about it. He did other things. He worked. He had a family.
content.tw: 過了五年，他仍然沒有獲得博士學位，因為他的點子太龐大了，需要好好思考。所以他先去工作，也有了自己的家庭。

content.en: Then he went to university again. He was 69 years old! Some people stop studying. They do not study again. But Nick did. Nick finished studying his math idea. He got his Ph.D. He was 75 years old!
content.tw: 等到他重回大學，已經 69 歲了! 他繼續鑽研數學， 75 歲那年終於完成了研究，得到了博士學位！

content.en: Nick shows us we can study and learn at any time in our lives!
content.tw: 尼克向我們展示了，我們可以在人生的任何時候學習和成長！

vocabulary.preface: 活到老學到老，尼克並沒有因為年齡而限制自己。

content.text:
1. study 讀書
Join our party Friday night, Paz. 來參加我們星期五晚上的派對吧。
There will be barbecue and music.會有烤肉，還有音樂。
Oh, I wish I could! 我真希望我能去！
But I need to study. 但是我要讀書。

2. year 年
You've already studied for two years! 你已經讀了兩年了。
I know, and I still have two more years to go. 我知道，還要再讀兩年呢。

3. get 獲得
Before getting your doctorate degree? 之後就拿到博士學位嗎？
Yeah. It feels like a long time. 對，感覺還要好久。

4. finish 完成
But after you finish, you can get a good job. 但是完成之後，就可以找到好工作。
If I am lucky. 要是我運氣好的話。

vocabulary.postscript:
這些單字簡單好用。
study 讀書
year 年
get 獲得
finish 完成

quiz.question: 1. What did Nick study?
2. How long did it take Nick to get a degree?
3. How old was Nick when he got his degree?

content.en: Tomorrow is International Dance Day! Dancing is cool. We can feel good, have fun, and listen to great music!
content.tw: 明天是世界舞蹈日！跳舞很好玩，還可以聽音樂！

content.en: A university in the USA has a marathon.
content.tw: 美國有一所大學，都會辦馬拉松比賽。

content.en: There are marathons all over the world. In many marathons, people run a long, long way. They run for 42 kilometers. Most run to get money for others. They give the money to people who need help.
content.tw: 全世界都有馬拉松，參賽者要跑42公里。很多人跑那麼累是為了募款，好捐獻給需要的人。

content.en: At Penn State University's marathon, students don't run. They dance! It's a dance marathon! Students dance for a long, long time. Penn State University has the world's biggest dance marathon.
content.tw: 賓州大學辦的這場馬拉松，不用跑步，而是要跳舞！這是全世界最大的跳舞馬拉松！

content.en: Students dance for 46 hours. That's nearly two days! No-one can sit or sleep! There is live music. There are DJs and dance crews. These help tired students to dance, dance, dance!
content.tw: 學生們連續跳舞46 個小時，不能坐下，也不能睡覺。現場 DJ 會放音樂，讓大家不停地跳！

content.en: This year over 707 students danced. They got 15 million US dollars! That's 458 million NT dollars! The money is helping very sick kids.
content.tw: 今年有超過707名學生跳舞。他們籌集到1500萬美元！相當於4.58億新台幣！這些錢正在幫助患有重病的孩子們。

vocabulary.preface: 一群大學生連續跳舞將近兩天兩夜，替罹患重病的兒童募款。

content.text:
1. tired 疲倦的
Oh, My God! I'm so tired! 天哪，我好累！
Uh hm, you've danced for three hours! 對啊，你跳了三個鐘頭了！
Really? That long? 真的？有那麼久喔？

2. sit 坐著
Now I must sit for a while. 現在我得坐一下了。
How come you're not dancing? 你怎麼沒有跳舞？
I was, but I'm listening to the music now. 我剛剛有跳，現在我在聽音樂。

3. music 音樂
Oh no, this is salsa, my favorite dance! 糟糕，這是騷沙，我最喜歡的舞曲！
I'd have to do this one! 這我一定要跳！

4. help 幫忙
Come on, let's dance together! 來吧，我們一起跳！
Alright, but you have to help me. 好吧，但是你得幫我。

vocabulary.postscript:
來讀讀單字。
tired 疲倦的
sit 坐
music 音樂
help 幫忙

quiz.question: 1. Where is Penn State University?
2. How many hours is the world's biggest dance marathon?
3. How much money did the students get this year?
